meanings.definition: A piece of furniture with a basin and pitcher for washing
meanings.sent1: The old washstand in the corner of the room held a large basin and pitcher.
meanings.sent2: I filled the basin on the washstand with water to wash my face.
meanings.sent3: As I approached the antique washstand, I half-expected it to start talking to me.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a cluttered washstand, filled with memories waiting to be washed away.
meanings.sent5: The elegant washstand gleamed in the sunlight, inviting me to freshen up.

meanings.definition: To wash one's hands at a washstand
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the children lined up to wash their hands at the washstand.
meanings.sent2: I always make sure to washstand before dinner to keep germs away.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to imitate me and ended up pawing at the washstand, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her tears seemed to washstand away all the worries that had been troubling her.
meanings.sent5: The sound of water splashing against the washstand was oddly soothing.
